TaxonIdentification.species_name: 红原薹草 hong yuan tai cao

treatment.description: Rhizome short, woody. Culms to 50 cm tall, trigonous, smooth, scabrous above, clothed at base with dark brown sheaths. Leaves shorter than culm, blades linear, 3–4 mm wide, flat, margins scabrous. Involucral bracts leafy, shorter than inflorescence, sheathless. Spikes 4, approximate; terminal spike male, long cylindric, 23–25 × 2–4 mm, with peduncle ca. 4 mm; lateral spikes female, cylindric, 1–2.5 × 0.5–0.6 cm, densely flowered, peduncles 1–2.7 cm. Female glumes dark brown, yellowish, or pale yellow, oblong, ca. 3.5 × 1.5 mm, 1-veined, apex obtuse. Utricles yellow-green, longer than glume, elliptic, compressed trigonous, ca. 4 × 2 mm, glabrous, 7–9-veined, constricted at both ends, beak short, orifice entire. Stigmas 3.
treatment.distribution: ● Ditch sides; ca. 3600 m. N Sichuan (Hongyuan).
